/>
V.iii.11.3.a
.
Definitions:  Hyper- and Hypothyroidism
Hyperthyroidism (over-active thyroid)
is a disorder where the thyroid gland synthesizes or creates excessive amounts of thyroid hormone.
Note
:  This condition may also be diagnosed as Graves’ disease.
Hypothyroidism
(under-active thyroid)
is a disorder where the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormone.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 11 - Endocrine Conditions
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 11, Section None
